intro: Ipomoea paposana, commonly known as the Hawaiian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces bright orange berries that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
